humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there is no metastatic carcinoma in the sentinel lymph nodes (AJCC pTN0) and all assessed lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma (0/5). This information aligns with New Rules 10 and 11, supporting the prediction of N0.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that there is no tumor seen in the sentinel lymph nodes (0/4) and only isolated tumor cells are found in one of the four lymph nodes. According to the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, 7th Edition, 'Isolated tumor cells (ITCs) are defined as small clusters of cells not greater than 0.2 mm, or single tumor cells, or groups of tumor cells numbering fewer than 200, which are typically detected by immunohistochemistry (IHC).' Since ITCs are not considered as metastatic cancer, the patient's N stage is N0 (no regional lymph node metastasis).
